cis175.clockproject

Class ClockTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • cis175.clockproject.ClockTime

  • public class ClockTime
extends java.lang.Object
    Concrete class used as a "smart" encapsulated variable to represent elapsed moments of time for a clock object. For purposes of this simulation one tick represents one second of elapsed time if Clock.driftPerSecond is zero.
    Version:
    1.0 CIS175 Spring 2019
    Author:
    Daniel Williams, Matthew Ambrose

      Standard Getter method.
      long getWholeSeconds()
      Variant Getter method, truncates fractional seconds into a whole (long) number.
      void incrementClockTime(double _driftPerSecond)
      Variant Setter method, it always increases ticks by exactly one.
      void resetTicks()
      Variant Setter method, it always sets ticks to zero.
      void setRealSeconds(double _driftPerSecond)
      Variant Setter method, calculates the simulated elapsed time using this clock's Clock.driftPerSecond value.

      Standard Setter method.

        public void setRealSeconds(double _driftPerSecond)
        Variant Setter method, calculates the simulated elapsed time using this clock's Clock.driftPerSecond value.
